ETHERNUM.LongRestInfo: Ether is restored only with long rest. There is no passive regeneration.
ETHERNUM.TalentsDescription: Talents work with the rank system. When making a check, roll:

Rune.Name: Rune Name
Rune.NoRunes: No runes created yet. Add your first rune to get started!
Rune.DescriptionPlaceholder: Describe the effects and properties of this rune...
Rune.DisabledByGM: This rune has been disabled by the Game Master
Rune.ClassLocked: Rune class locked! Use Override to try to activate.

1.Name: Anchoring (Stability)
1.Focus: Personal Defense, Attribute Buff, Touch Damage
1.Visual: Tattoos/runes glow faintly on the skin

2.Name: Projection (Directional)
2.Visual: Ether exits the body (smoke, light, sound)

3.Name: Manifestation (Environmental)
3.Focus: Area of Effect (AoE), Crowd Control, Terrain Alteration
3.Cost: Medium (Stress damage on failed CON check)
3.Visual: Environment reacts: ground shakes, air temperature changes

4.Name: Disruption (Law Alteration)
4.Focus: Permanent Effects, Temporary Invulnerability, Matter Creation
4.Cost: High (Max HP damage or guaranteed Corruption)

Override.Title: Override (Break the Glass)
Override.Description: A character can attempt to use a higher Rune Class in a moment of desperation. But Ethernum charges dearly.
Override.SuccessResult: The arm used 'burns' (unusable until advanced medical repair) + Exhaustion Level 3
Override.FailureResult: Patronage collapses. Massive area damage or immediate mutation (Game Over)
Override.FailureDescription: Patronage collapsed! The character suffers catastrophic consequences:
Override.Consequence2: OR immediate mutation - character becomes an 'Ether Aberration'
Override.SuccessDescription: The rune was activated at maximum power, but at a price:
Override.SuccessNotification: Override successful, but with severe consequences!

GM.MaxRuneClassHint: Defines which rune class the player can use without needing Override.

Calculator.Description: Use the power of ether to enhance your Pathfinder 2E dice rolls.
Calculator.Hint: Equipped runes can be activated at any time. Your character's ether power will be automatically added to compatible rolls.

Notifications.LongRestComplete: Long rest complete! Ether fully restored.

Errors.NoActor: No actor selected to make the roll.
Errors.NotEnoughEther: Not enough ether to activate this rune!
Errors.RuneDisabled: This rune is disabled by the Game Master.

Warnings.NotPF2E: This module is designed to work with the Pathfinder 2E system. Some features may not be available.

LongRestFullRestore.Name: Full Restoration on Long Rest
LongRestFullRestore.Hint: If enabled, ether will be fully restored when the character takes a long rest.

ShowEtherInChat.Name: Show Ether in Chat
ShowEtherInChat.Hint: If enabled, displays ether information in roll messages in chat.

AllowOverride.Name: Allow Override
AllowOverride.Hint: If enabled, players can attempt to use runes of higher classes than allowed (with consequences).
